snippet: The national director of the Anti-Defamation League for almost three decades, who has been one of the nation’s most prominent Jewish spokesmen, is retiring on July 20.
abstract: Anti-Defamation League national director Abraham H Foxman is set to retire after serving organization for almost three decades; in that time Foxman has become one of leading voices against anti-Semitism, and has become one of first people whose views are sought on controversies that involve Jews or Israel.
lead_paragraph: The national director of the Anti-Defamation League for almost three decades, who has been one of the nation’s most prominent Jewish spokesmen, is retiring on July 20.

headline.main: Abraham Foxman to Retire After 28 Years of Fighting Anti-Semitism
headline.print_headline: A Resonant Voice Fighting Anti-Semitism Retires After 28 Years
